reporter-output.line: Open url 'http://qa5.qa.nbcupublisher7.publisher7.com'.
Enter the user's email address in the 'Email Address' text box.
Enter the user's password in the 'Password' text box.
Click the 'Login' button.
Click the 'Modules' menu link.
Switch to frame titled 'Modules'.
Enter 'Focal Point' in the 'Filter Name' text box.
Wait for the module titled 'Focal Point' to appear in the list.
Verify the 'Focal Point' check box is checked.
Click the 'Close Overlay X'.
Mouse over the 'Configuration' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Media' menu link.
Click the 'Focal Point' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Focal Point dialog'.
Click the 'Save configuration' button.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Click the 'Close Overlay X'.
Mouse over the 'Configuration' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Media' menu link.
Click the 'Image styles' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Image styles dialog'.
Click the 'delete' link for style name 'AutomationFocalStyle'.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Optionally select a style before deleting AutomationFocalStyle dialog'.
Click the 'Delete' button.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Image styles dialog'.
Verify success message of 'Style AutomationFocalStyle was deleted.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Click the 'Close Overlay X'.
Mouse over the 'Configuration' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Media' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Image styles' menu link.
Click the 'Add style' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Image styles dialog'.
Enter 'AutomationFocalStyle' in the 'Style name' text box.
Click the 'Create new style' button.
Select 'Focal Point Crop' from the 'EFFECT' drop down list.
Click the 'Add' button.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Add Focal Point Crop effect dialog'.
Enter '200' in the 'Width' text box.
Enter '200' in the 'Height' text box.
Click the 'Add effect' button.
Verify success message of 'The image effect was successfully applied.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Click the 'Update style' button.
Verify success message of 'Changes to the style have been saved.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Verify the text 'AutomationFocalStyle' is present on the page.
Verify the text '200px' is present on the page.
Click the 'Close Overlay X'.
Mouse over the 'Structure' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Content types' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Movie' menu link.
Click the 'Manage display' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Movie dialog'.
Select 'Rendered file' from the Cover Media 'Format' drop down list.
Verify the default view mode is selected.
Click the 'Save' button.
Verify success message of 'Your settings have been saved.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Click the 'Close Overlay X'.
Mouse over the 'Structure' menu link.
Mouse over the 'File types' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Image' menu link.
Click the 'Manage file display' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Image dialog'.
Select the 'AutomationFocalStyle' option from the 'Image Style' drop down list.
Click the 'Save configuration' button.
Verify success message of 'Your settings have been saved.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Click the 'Close Overlay X'.
Mouse over the 'Content' menu link.
Mouse over the 'Add content' menu link.
Click the 'Movie' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Create Movie dialog'.
Enter '344c8c55f17b427' in the 'Title' text box.
Switch to the Synopsis frame.
Enter a randomized text string into the 'Body' text area.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Create Movie dialog'.
Click the 'Cover' select button.
Switch to the select file frame.
Enter the file path for file upload.
Click the 'Upload' button.
Wait for the file link to be visible after upload.
Click the 'Next' button.
Click the 'Public Local Files' radio button.
Click the 'Next' button.
Verify the file image 'HanSolo' is present.
Verify the img is loaded and visible.
Double click the focal point indicator arrow.
Verify value of 'Focal Point' text box is '50,50'.
Click the 'Save' button.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Create Movie dialog'.
Click the 'Save' button.
Verify success message of 'Movie 344c8c55f17b427 has been created.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
Assert that img source of the Media Item contains 'HanSolo'.
Assert the the img is loaded and visible.
Assert that the workbench image width = '200' and the image height = '200'.
Click the 'Modules' menu link.
Switch to the active frame titled 'Modules dialog'.
Enter 'Focal Point' in the 'Filter Name' text box.
Wait for the module titled 'Focal Point' to appear in the list.
Uncheck the 'Focal Point' module checkbox.
Click the 'Save configuration' button.
Verify success message of 'The configuration options have been saved.' is present.
Verify there are no errors present.
